content: this is dmg and we're making a bone pile yeah
okay so we're making a pile of burns so what you do is just grab a thin piece of
cardstock and what I have my favorite big bag here is a bag of very floppy
skeletons now usually I grab these around the time of Halloween from the
dollar store there's tons and tons and tons of them especially in Halloween is
just finished and they want to get a really stock so I've got lots and lots
of bags of skeletons so I cut out about a two inch two inch two inch circle for
a base and I just snip off any excess hanging stuff and now I'm just gonna
chop up the skeleton into bone paths so this is relatively simple to do and just
cutting out the rib cage cutting out to the hip bones and then the individual
leg bones and arm bones as well and we'll use this to basically elegantly
put together a pile of bones so now onto the base would just apply some hot glue
in the middle and start with the rib cage and they don't move on to the hip
bones and the skulls so if you want you can have several skeletons and and do
this obviously the skeleton is oversized in terms of the twenty-eighth norm the
minis but that's okay because once the parlor bones people don't really notice
that it's about ten times bigger than the mini itself so this is a great use
for it unless you want to have a giant skeleton you can lay it out more longer
than anatomically along the base but this just makes for a great great little
piece to put in the middle of the dungeon to emphasize a long dead person
or foe and just stack up the bones on top of one another so that it looks like
a quite a loose arrangement and then you just flat black it spray paint and I
just dusted it with a mixture of yellow and white and then brown and white and
then just then I just did it ahah you dry brush highlights with white to get
the edges of the bones right limbs trialed bhavish if you liked this video
